admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The loan for the Agricultural Services
            Project for Portugal was approved by the Board on June 26,
            1984 but never signed. The project is not rated and will not
            be audited. The loan was never signed because of internal
            disagreements within the Ministry of Agriculture with
            project objectives. A contributing factor was that in 1985
            Portugal was on the verge of becoming a member of the
            European Community (EC), which agreed to provide funding for
            this project number under an earlier aid scheme. In late
            1984, the Minister of Agriculture confirmed his full
            support, but noted that the project stood a good chance of
            being cofinanced by the EC. The EC confirmed this option and
            the Bank also agreed to this solution. However, as no
            decision was being made, in early June 1985 the Bank
            informed the Government that it would withdraw the loan if
            it was not signed. The loan was withdrawn on July 15, 1985.
            Despite the withdrawal of the loan proposal, all preparatory
            work done by the Bank was not lost as the Ministry of
            Agriculture carried out many of the project components under
            EC financing. The short experience of this project permits
            no major lessons. However, knowing that Portugal was about
            to join the EC, the Bank staff might have sought to
            cooperate more closely with the Government in the
            preparation of a cofinancing scheme.
